column2: Søroyar to the west of Ross seems like a good target. It would be a nice addition to our border, plus his maximum numbers of levy is not very impressive. Click on the province.
column3: Søroyar to the west of Ross seems like a good target. It would be a nice addition to our border, plus his maximum numbers of levy is not very impressive. Click on the province.

column2: Now let's send our chancellor out on a secret mission to fabricate claims. Click the fabricate claims button, then click on Søroyar to place the chancellor there.
column3: Now let's send our chancellor out on a secret mission to fabricate claims. Click the fabricate claims button, then click on Søroyar to place the chancellor there.

column2: What instigates a Crusade is that the Pope appoints an area that needs to be conquered in the name of the Catholic church. For him to be able to do that, it must currently be held by Muslims or Pagans. When he does this, a special Crusade war will begin which you are able to join by going to the Pope's diplomatic interactions and choosing 'Offer to Join War'.
column3: What instigates a Crusade is that the Pope appoints an area that needs to be conquered in the name of the Catholic church. For him to be able to do that, it must currently be held by Muslims or Pagans. When he does this, a special Crusade war will begin which you are able to join by going to the Pope's diplomatic interactions and choosing 'Offer to Join War'.

column2: If a Crusade is successful, the ruler who had the biggest impact (highest participation score) on the Catholic side of the war will be considered to have won the Crusade.
column3: If a Crusade is successful, the ruler who had the biggest impact (highest participation score) on the Catholic side of the war will be considered to have won the Crusade.

column2: Should you choose to join the Crusade and manage to be the one that wins the Crusade, you will be given all the land held by the enemy in the Crusade area. You will also get piety and prestige, as well as a Crusader trait.
column3: Should you choose to join the Crusade and manage to be the one that wins the Crusade, you will be given all the land held by the enemy in the Crusade area. You will also get piety and prestige, as well as a Crusader trait.

column2: Should you join the Crusade but one of the other Catholics wins it, you will not get any land but you will still get piety and prestige, as well as the Crusader trait. Click next to end this part.
column3: Should you join the Crusade but one of the other Catholics wins it, you will not get any land but you will still get piety and prestige, as well as the Crusader trait. Click next to end this part.

column2: Religious vassals of Catholic rulers will only give you troops and money if they have a higher opinion of you than they do of the Pope. The easiest way to assure that, is to actually appoint someone to bishop that already likes you. Click the laws tab to see how you can accomplish that.
column3: Religious vassals of Catholic rulers will only give you troops and money if they have a higher opinion of you than they do of the Pope. The easiest way to assure that, is to actually appoint someone to bishop that already likes you. Click the laws tab to see how you can accomplish that.

column2: You can have one plot and one ambition active at any given time. If you already have a plot and want to scheme against another character, you will have to cancel your old plot first.
column3: You can have one plot and one ambition active at any given time. If you already have a plot and want to scheme against another character, you will have to cancel your old plot first.

column2: To the left of your portait you can see a small circular button called 'Choose an Ambition'. Here you can set an ambition for your current character. Example ambitions can be to get married, to hoard up a big pile of gold, get a thousand prestige or other things like this. When you succeed with an ambition, you will also get some kind of reward, a better reward for a harder ambition of course.
column3: To the left of your portait you can see a small circular button called 'Choose an Ambition'. Here you can set an ambition for your current character. Example ambitions can be to get married, to hoard up a big pile of gold, get a thousand prestige or other things like this. When you succeed with an ambition, you will also get some kind of reward, a better reward for a harder ambition of course.

column2: We talked about ambitions in the intermediary intrigue tutorial. Plots can also be chosen from the character portrait screen by finding a character you wish to plot against and clicking the 'Choose a Plot' button. However, because it's hard to know exactly who you would benefit from plotting against, an easier way is to use the plot selector in the intrigue screen to find interesting plots. It is a large button called 'Click to choose a plot'.
column3: We talked about ambitions in the intermediary intrigue tutorial. Plots can also be chosen from the character portrait screen by finding a character you wish to plot against and clicking the 'Choose a Plot' button. However, because it's hard to know exactly who you would benefit from plotting against, an easier way is to use the plot selector in the intrigue screen to find interesting plots. It is a large button called 'Click to choose a plot'.

column2: This part will tell you about ambitions. All playable characters can select an ambition in addition to plotting devious schemes. Click your character portait to learn more.
column3: This part will tell you about ambitions. All playable characters can select an ambition in addition to plotting devious schemes. Click your character portait to learn more.

column2: In the military tab you can see that there are two different kind of levies: Personal levies and vassal levies. Personal levies are the ones you control yourself while the vassal levies are the levies controlled by your vassals and the vassals of your vassals. Click next to continue.
column3: In the military tab you can see that there are two different kind of levies: Personal levies and vassal levies. Personal levies are the ones you control yourself while the vassal levies are the levies controlled by your vassals and the vassals of your vassals. Click next to continue.

column2: Because you are playing as a Catholic ruler, provinces owned by religious holders like bishops will only give you money if their opinions of you are higher than their opinion of the Pope. Otherwise the money goes to him. Vassals other than bishops will always give you money, but you will get more if they like you.
column3: Because you are playing as a Catholic ruler, provinces owned by religious holders like bishops will only give you money if their opinions of you are higher than their opinion of the Pope. Otherwise the money goes to him. Vassals other than bishops will always give you money, but you will get more if they like you.

column2: Adult §Y$DYNASTY$§! men at court: §Y$NUM$§! (§Y$GOLD$§!¤ each).
column3: Adult §Y$DYNASTY$§! men at court: §Y$NUM$§! (§Y$GOLD$§!¤ each).

column2: Adult male courtiers of the Patrician's dynasty all require a share of the income. In return, they increase the Trade Post limit.
column3: Adult male courtiers of the Patrician's dynasty all require a share of the income. In return, they increase the Trade Post limit.

column2: §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to seize control of the coastal §Y$TITLE$§! since he or a vassal Patrician has a Trade Post in place, or the target is a rival merchant republic.
column3: §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to seize control of the coastal §Y$TITLE$§! since he or a vassal Patrician has a Trade Post in place, or the target is a rival merchant republic.

column2: As a Merchant Republic, §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to seize control of §Y$TITLE$§! since they already control a city there and the county is within range.
column3: As a Merchant Republic, §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to seize control of §Y$TITLE$§! since they already control a city there and the county is within range.

column2: Trade Post Limit: §Y$LIMIT$§!
column3: Trade Post Limit: §Y$LIMIT$§!

column2: Minimum Trade Post Limit: §Y$NUM$§!
column3: Minimum Trade Post Limit: §Y$NUM$§!

column2: Adult Male Family Members in Court: §Y+$VALUE$§!
column3: Adult Male Family Members in Court: §Y+$VALUE$§!

column2: Is not over Trade Post Limit
column3: Is not over Trade Post Limit

column2: Breaking the Truce (ends on §Y$DATE$§!) would cost you §R$PRESTIGE$§! Prestige. You would be considered a '§YTruce Breaker§!', lowering all §Y[Recipient.Religion.GetGroupName]§! rulers' opinion of you by §R$OPINION$§!.
column3: Breaking the Truce (ends on §Y$DATE$§!) would cost you §R$PRESTIGE$§! Prestige and lower all §Y[Recipient.Religion.GetGroupName]§! rulers' opinion of you by §R$OPINION$§!. You will be considered a '§YTruce Breaker§!' (§R-5§! Diplomacy for §Y5§! years.)

column2: Using this option is viewed as tyrannical, and will lower the opinions of all characters in the Republic of you by §R$OPINION$§!
column3: Using this option is viewed as tyrannical, and will lower the opinions of all characters in the Republic of you by §R$OPINION$§!
